column4: i see the file through samba - i just get an error when trying ot mount
by default windows XPsp2 and later make shares only accessable by user 'Anonymous' unless you change your default sharing settings
by default your samba client will ask you for a user name if you go through the nautalis interface

easiest way is in an explorer window, Tools => folder options and there's a tab in there with a bunch of check boxes, at the bottom is one where you can disable 'simple sharing' which is what prevents using anything but Anonymouse to connect
harder way is through Group Policy Editor
shane3 definately choose the easier route
do you see the tab in folder options that has all the check boxes, with things like "show hidden files" and "hide extenstions of known file types"?
shane3:  yes i see that folder
just got this off microsoft page Note You cannot disable simple file sharing in Windows XP Home Edition.
ah yes, home edition... I'm so used to people using pro... then you need to connect as Anonymous without a password from samba
are you using the command line samba client or the nautalis interface (which would be using the 'connect to server' dialog int he desktop gui)
i'm not haveing any luck with this - i can't get past the password prompt - right or wront i need gui to survive
assume that the ip address of the windows machine is IPADDRESS... then use this command: smbclient -L //IPADDRESS -U Anonymous
if that doesn't work then you need to check the firewall settings on your windows machine
so take that error message, put it in quotes, paste that in to google along with the terms ubuntu, smbclient and windows home.... and you'll be doing the the next things I would be doing
